docs.lead_paragraph: Comedian Bill Cosby was sued for defamation on Wednesday in Massachusetts by a sexual assault accuser who said he branded her a liar in public statements made through his representatives denying her allegations of abuse.

docs.lead_paragraph: Exposed to the light of day, a year-end, $1.1 trillion spending bill drew vociferous objections from liberals and milder criticism from conservatives on Wednesday while lawmakers readied a brief, stopgap measure to prevent a government shutdown both parties vowed to avoid.

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Prince William and his wife, Kate, wrapped up their first visit to New York in a three-day whirlwind that included a black-tie reception, a meeting with the other king, LeBron James, and a solemn, rain-drenched visit to the National Sept. 11 Memorial and Museum.

docs.lead_paragraph: A prominent liberal group is urging Massachusetts Democratic Sen. Elizabeth Warren to seek the White House in 2016 and plans to spend $1 million in support of a new effort in early presidential primary states.

docs.lead_paragraph: "I can't breathe!" — the exclamation made by a black man, Eric Garner, while being placed in a police chokehold — was chosen as the most notable quote of the year in an annual list released by a Yale University librarian.

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Prince William and his wife, Kate, paid their respects with a handwritten note Tuesday at the Sept. 11 museum and told its leaders they were struck by the enormity of the loss in the 2001 terror attacks.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A debate over whether to reappoint the budget director raises a larger question about resistance to good news.
docs.snippet: A debate over whether to reappoint the budget director raises a larger question about resistance to good news....
docs.abstract: David Leonhardt The Upshot; debate in Congress over whether to reappoint Douglas Elmendorf as head of Congressional Budget Office underscores nation's resistance to good economic news; central plank of anti-Elmendorf case is notion that his budget office underestimated health care costs when evaluating health care reform law, when in fact the office overestimated medical costs.

headline.main: The Battle Over Douglas Elmendorf — and the Inability to See Good News
headline.print_headline: A Puzzling Resistance to Good Economic News

docs.lead_paragraph: The liberal group MoveOn.org is poised to spend $1 million on a campaign to draft Senator Warren, the Massachusetts Democrat, into the 2016 presidential race.
docs.snippet: The liberal group MoveOn.org is poised to spend $1 million on a campaign to draft Senator Warren, the Massachusetts Democrat, into the 2016 presidential race....
docs.abstract: Liberal group MoveOn.org is ready to spend $1 million on campaign to draft Democratic Massachusetts Sen Elizabeth Warren into 2016 presidential race; it is indication of desire among some activists for more progressive alternative to Hillary Rodham Clinton.

headline.print_headline: Looking to Nudge Warren Into ’16 Race
headline.main: MoveOn.org Looks to Nudge Elizabeth Warren Into 2016 Presidential Race
